Given that you mentioned 'The Hurt Locker' and showed an interest in a film with a gripping plot, I'd recommend you watch 'End of Watch'. This movie is shot documentary-style and follows the daily grind of two young police officers in LA, showcasing their encounters with criminal forces greater than themselves. It stars Jake Gyllenhaal, who also appeared in 'The Hurt Locker'.

Alternatively, if you're interested in exploring a different genre but still find Donald Sutherland among the cast, I'd suggest 'Pride & Prejudice'. This romantic drama revolves around Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, their clashing personalities, and their eventual romance.
